chapter.title: Trade Calendar
chapter.para: This chapter describes a set of screens that provides an innovative type of report whose results are presented in a calendar. This feature provides an online front-end to track the events related to user transactions.
For example, it helps an exporter to track in advance the upcoming expiry date of a letter of credit issued in his or her favor, or a customer to anticipate the approaching maturity date of a loan.

section.title: Overview
section.para: Using the Trade Calendar module you can track the events related to your transactions initiated through the Portal, together with any custom events (like appointments or reminders) related to the activity of your company, in much the same way that you would through a shared electronic calendar.

This module enables you to monitor key dates related to the products handled by the system, as well as adding your own custom events or alerts, turning your Portal page into an automated and customized scheduler.

The calendar appears on your home page, together with today's events. It is also accessible as a full screen application where events can be displayed by day or month or by type over a longer period of time in the Milestone View. For any event related to an existing transaction, a dedicated link gives you access to the transaction details and history through a single click.
The following sections describe the three main components of the Trade Calendar viz. the Calendar Component, the Trade Events Component, and the Application Component.

section.title: Calendar Component
section.para: This component displays the calendar itself. It displays a calendar for the month, the current business date in your time zone highlighted, and serves as a table of contents to access the details of any date. Click a day to see a full page view of that day's events. Click the month name to see a full-page view of the month's events. Click the arrows around the month name to see the previous and following months.

Days associated with key dates are automatically highlighted with a specific background color. With this visual information, it is easy to detect right from the home page the key transactional events taking place during the month.

section.title: Trade Events Component
section.para: This component summarizes the key events of the current date and displays various alerts related to pending transactions or recent notifications. This section of the screen is composed of three subsections, each covering a specific type of event. Depending on your site, you may not have all three of these subsections.

section.title: Trade Events
section.para: This list is a summary of all the events of the current day. Events shown are those for your company's transactions, plus any custom events manually added by any of your company's users.
The transactions displayed are the records bearing a key date equal to the current business date.

section.title: Recent Pending Transactions
section.para: This list shows the most recent pending transactions initiated within your company, for any product and any type of transaction, whether initiation, amendment or message. Pending means Incomplete (Draft) or Uncontrolled (Unsigned), and hence not yet sent to the bank.

Each entry shows the transaction's System ID, followed by the product code and the transaction type (New, Amend, or Message). Click the System ID to open the transaction record in the appropriate mode for its status. That is, a transaction that only needs to be signed opens in non-editable mode, whereas an incomplete record opens in the edit form for its transaction type.

To avoid over-crowding your home page, the list shows, by default, only the 5 most recent such transactions (sorted by input date). This can be changed by setting a different value in the relevant configuration file.

section.title: Application Component
section.para: When you click a date or the month name in the Trade Calendar component on your home page, it opens the calendar application to show a full-page view displaying the following.

section.title: Types of Calendar View
section.para: The full-screen view has a calendar just like that on the home page, on the left-hand side. This is called Standard view. Click Switch to Milestones View beneath it is to switch to Milestone View.
In Standard view, the calendar is limited to one month and you can enter two dates within 30 days to limit its search. To display a single day, set both dates equal to that day.

The Trade Calendar opens in Standard View by default. If you clicked a specific day, the main part of the screen shows all the events of that day. If you clicked a month name, it shows all the events of the month.

In Milestone View, the search can span over a period of up to three months. Key dates are not grouped by date, but rather by product and then product type. The date range can be set in the search criteria fields at the top of the screen. To return to Standard view, click Switch to Standard View, below the calendar.

section.title: List of Events
section.para: As usual with lists, you can enter search criteria in a group of fields at the top of the list and click Search, to display the records that match these criteria.
List of Events displays the following fields, depending on the type of view selected:

Both Standard View and Milestone View
Indicates the day of the event.
Both Standard View and Milestone View
Shows either the product code, if it is a key date of a transaction record, or the key word Ev. if the event is added manually to the calendar.
Both Standard View and Milestone View

Provides a description of the key date, if it involves a transaction record (such as Issue Date, Expiry Date, Maturity Date, Last Shipment Date, Application Date, etc.). Else, it displays the title chosen by the user while entering the details of the custom event.
For a static event, it indicates the name of the event's owner.
